paragraphs.heading: About Christine
paragraphs.content: Having started out life with a love for watching films and a view to treading the boards, I found my passion lay with writing and creating new worlds. Plus my feet were too big and clumsy for said boards. I spent the next decade reading and researching as much as I could, while working in the events and hospitality industry. Boy could I tell a story or two. And so I did...

I finally took the plunge and changed my career. In September 2011 I enrolled in a screenwriting course at Edinburgh University and everything snowballed from there. I graduated from Screen Academy Scotland, Edinburgh Napier University in 2012 with an MA in Screenwriting.

Since then I have reached the final stages of prestigious screenwriting competitions including the PAGE International Screenwriting Contest, Screencraft's shorts and comedy categories, and the Hollywood Screenplay Contest. I was selected to take part in the ENGAGE European training and development programme for emerging directors, writers and producers. I have successfully pitched a feature project at the Edinburgh International Film Festival for Cascade Media's writers couch initiative.
When I'm not furiously typing away on the computer or visiting the cinema, I can be found eating sushi, making sushi (badly) or baking cookies (very well or so I'm told).
If you would like to get in touch with me about anything please visit the contact section.
